intro: Calceolaria adenanthera subsp. adenanthera, commonly known as the "Mexican slipper orchid," is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, slipper-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats and produces showy, bilaterally symmetrical blooms in shades of yellow and orange. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant and unique floral structure. The species is also noted for its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
